  Class java.Nutmeg.DoBlock



java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.Nutmeg.DoBlock






  
 public class DoBlock
  
 extends Object


Copyright (c) 1995, 1996 THOUGHT Inc. All Rights Reserved.

DoBlock class
This class allows for arbitrary blocks of code to be executed as part
of the collection operations which support it.  This is meant to provide
a workaround for the functionality provided in smalltalk for passing
arbitrary blocks of code as parameters to methods.





  




  
 
	DoBlock()
  
 Constructor for DoBlock.




  




  
 
	doBlock()
  
 Executes with no parameters.
  
 
	doBlock(Object)
  
 Executes with object which is to be evaluated.
  
 
	doBlock(Object, Object)
  
 Executes with objects which are to be evaluated.
  
 
	doBlockNew()
  
 Creates a new object as part of the execution.





  




DoBlock

  protected DoBlock()




  
 Constructor for DoBlock.





  



doBlock

  public boolean doBlock()




  
 Executes with no parameters.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 boolean True if successful execution of block, false if not.
  




doBlock

  public boolean doBlock(Object anObject)




  
 Executes with object which is to be evaluated.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The object to be evaluated.
    
 Returns:
    
 boolean True if block is successful, false if not.
  




doBlock

  public boolean doBlock(Object anObject1,
                         Object anObject2)




  
 Executes with objects which are to be evaluated.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject1 - The first object to be evaluated.
    
 anObject2 - The second object to be evaluated.
    
 Returns:
    
 boolean True if block is successful, false if not.
  




doBlockNew

  public Object doBlockNew()




  
 Creates a new object as part of the execution.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 Object New object if block is successful, null if not.
